children.name: Ammon
children.sourceText: I will not slay Ammon, neither will I return to the land of Ishmael, but I go to the land of Middoni that I may release the brethren of Ammon, for I know that they are just men and holy prophets of the true God.

children.name: Antiomno
children.sourceText: I know, in the strength of the Lord thou canst do all things. But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of prison.Who told thee that thy brethren were in prison?

children.name: abundant
children.sourceText: And he began to cry unto the Lord, saying: O Lord, have mercy; according to thy abundant mercy which thou hast had upon the people of Nephi, have upon me, and my people.

children.name: are
children.sourceText: Yea, I believe that he created all things which are in the earth; but I do not know the heavens.

children.name: armies
children.sourceText: And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.name: arms
children.sourceText: How knowest thou the thoughts of my heart? Thou mayest speak boldly, and tell me concerning these things; and also tell me by what power ye slew and smote off the arms of my brethren that scattered my flocks;

children.name: art
children.sourceText: Who art thou? Art thou that Great Spirit, who knows all things?

children.name: be
children.sourceText: Blessed be the name of God, and blessed art thou.

children.name: been
children.sourceText: Surely there has not been any servant among all my servants that has been so faithful as this man; for even he doth remember all my commandments to execute them.

children.name: believe
children.sourceText: Yea, I will believe all thy words.

children.name: born
children.sourceText: For as sure as thou livest, behold, I have seen my Redeemer; and he shall come forth, and be born of a woman, and he shall redeem all mankind who believe on his name.

children.name: brethren
children.sourceText: Now I know that it is the Great Spirit; and he has come down at this time to preserve your lives, that I might not slay you as I did your brethren. Now this is the Great Spirit of whom our fathers have spoken.

children.name: canst
children.sourceText: I know, in the strength of the Lord thou canst do all things. But behold, I will go with thee to the land of Middoni; for the king of the land of Middoni, whose name is Antiomno, is a friend unto me; therefore I go to the land of Middoni, that I may flatter the king of the land, and he will cast thy brethren out of prison.Who told thee that thy brethren were in prison?

children.name: created

children.name: desire
children.sourceText: Now I surely know that this is the Great Spirit, and I would desire him that he come in unto me, but I durst not.

children.name: desirest
children.sourceText: And now, if thou wilt tell me concerning these things, whatsoever thou desirest I will give unto thee; and if it were needed, I would guard thee with my armies; but I know that thou art more powerful than all they; nevertheless, whatsoever thou desirest of me I will grant it unto thee.

children.sourceText: I do not know what that meaneth.

children.sourceText: Surely, this is more than a man. Behold, is not this the Great Spirit who doth send such great punishments upon this people, because of their murders?

children.name: plead
children.sourceText: Come, I will go with thee down to the land of Middoni, and there I will plead with the king that he will cast thy brethren out of prison.

children.name: power
